intro: Campanula pulla var. pseudopulla, commonly known as the dark bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive dark purple to almost black flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or woodland borders. Its ornamental value lies in its striking flower color and compact growth habit.
